We are hiring at Radioactive Technologies.Full time Contract OpportunityFully Remoteplease share resume at Khalil@weradioactive.comSoftware Developer (Dot Net Core) â€“ GDS Integration Experience: 6+ YearsDuration: 3 Months-(Extendable up to 1 Year)Job Summary:We are seeking a skilled and motivated Software Developer / Dot Net Core Developer to join our team, focusing on the development and maintenance of software solutions for Global Distribution System (GDS) integration. This role will involve working closely with cross-functional teams to design, develop, test, and deploy software that facilitates seamless communication and data exchange between our systems and various GDS platforms.Responsibilities:Design and Develop: Design, develop, and implement software solutions for GDS integration, ensuring compliance with industry standards and best practices.Integration: Integrate new software with existing systems, databases, and applications, focusing on efficient data flow and interoperability.Testing and Debugging: Thoroughly test software and debug to identify and resolve issues, ensuring the reliability and performance of GDS integrations.Maintenance and Improvement: Maintain and upgrade current software by adding new features, addressing bugs, and optimizing performance.Collaboration: Work closely with product managers, business analysts, and other developers to understand requirements and deliver solutions.Troubleshooting: Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to GDS integrations, ensuring minimal disruption to business operations.Performance Monitoring: Monitor the performance of GDS integrations and identify areas for improvement.Core Focus:Strong knowledge of the travel industry and GDS workflows.Technical Skills:Proficiency in programming languages such as Dot Net Core, Java, Python.Experience with GDS platforms and protocols ( Amadeus, Sabre, Galileo, Travelport).Familiarity with RESTful APIs, SOAP, and other integration technologies.Experience with database technologies (MsSQL, NoSQL).Experience with version control systems (e.g., Git).Qualifications:Education: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field.Experience: Minimum 5+ years of experience in software development, with a strong focus on integration and API development with all GDS systems.hashtag#DotNetCore hashtag#SoftwareDeveloper hashtag#GDSIntegration hashtag#Amadeus hashtag#Sabre Load Test Engineer (3-month Contract)This role is expected to: - Gather initial environment requirements and determine the necessary toolset for performance testing.- Define performance testing criteria and parameters.- Model and simulate complex testing scenarios.- Design appropriate test flows based on business use cases.- Develop load tests for components, microservices, APIs, and end-to-end user journeys.- Configure and execute tests utilizing various load generating platforms.- Utilize application performance monitoring tools to identify and diagnose bottlenecks across multiple technologies, platforms, and datasets.- Analyze application characteristics and capacities to prepare for high-volume transaction periods.- Prepare and execute test scenarios to reproduce production issues in lower scaled environments.- Document all testing results and analysis in clear and concise formats.- Communicate test results and analysis to technical leads and stakeholders.- Demonstrate strong technical expertise in writing complex testing scripts using tools such as JMeter/BlazeMeter and LoadRunner. Possess hands-on scripting experience with programming languages/tools such as Java, HTML, Selenium, K6, JavaScript, Python, SQL, or shell scripting.- Familiarity with APM tools such as DynaTrace, DataDog, or AppDynamics is required.- Actively participate in multiple remote meetings on a daily basis.- Demonstrate ability to adapt to shifting priorities.- Possess effective communication skills within a business context.- Verify the impact of any application or infrastructure change (e.g., Maintenance Releases, hardware, OS upgrades)â€¦Read the full job description here: https://lnkd.in/e6XD8pQD Location: San Francisoco, CAApplicants should apply via The Mice Groups Inc. website (www.micegroups.com), through this careers site posting, or email ashish.shinde@micegroups.com for this position. Pay for this position is based on market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. As a contractor you may also be eligible for health benefits such as health, dental, and vision as well as access to a 401K plan.  We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at The Mice Groups Inc. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.Pursuant to the Los Angeles Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records. This position pays between $25 and $35 per hour.  Load Test Engineer (3-month Contract)This role is expected to: - Gather initial environment requirements and determine the necessary toolset for performance testing.- Define performance testing criteria and parameters.- Model and simulate complex testing scenarios.- Design appropriate test flows based on business use cases.- Develop load tests for components, microservices, APIs, and end-to-end user journeys.- Configure and execute tests utilizing various load generating platforms.- Utilize application performance monitoring tools to identify and diagnose bottlenecks across multiple technologies, platforms, and datasets.- Analyze application characteristics and capacities to prepare for high-volume transaction periods.- Prepare and execute test scenarios to reproduce production issues in lower scaled environments.- Document all testing results and analysis in clear and concise formats.- Communicate test results and analysis to technical leads and stakeholders.- Demonstrate strong technical expertise in writing complex testing scripts using tools such as JMeter/BlazeMeter and LoadRunner. Possess hands-on scripting experience with programming languages/tools such as Java, HTML, Selenium, K6, JavaScript, Python, SQL, or shell scripting.- Familiarity with APM tools such as DynaTrace, DataDog, or AppDynamics is required.- Actively participate in multiple remote meetings on a daily basis.- Demonstrate ability to adapt to shifting priorities.- Possess effective communication skills within a business context.- Verify the impact of any application or infrastructure change (e.g., Maintenance Releases, hardware, OS upgrades)â€¦Read the full job description here: https://lnkd.in/e6XD8pQD Location: San Francisoco, CAApplicants should apply via The Mice Groups Inc. website (www.micegroups.com), through this careers site posting, or email ashish.shinde@micegroups.com for this position. Pay for this position is based on market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. As a contractor you may also be eligible for health benefits such as health, dental, and vision as well as access to a 401K plan.  We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at The Mice Groups Inc. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.Pursuant to the Los Angeles Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records. The Mice Groups Inc. values your privacy. Please consult our Candidate Privacy Notice, for information about how we collect, use, and disclose personal information of our candidates.

in data migration from relational databases (e.g., Oracle, MySQL) to MongoDB.Experience integrating MongoDB with programming languages like Python, Java, or Node.js.Knowledge of data security, compliance (e.g., GDPR, HIPAA), and backup/restore strategies.Familiarity with DevOps practices, including CI/CD pipelines and infrastructure as code (Terraform, Ansible).Strong communication and documentation skills with a collaborative mindset.Preferred Qualifications:MongoDB Certified DBA/Developer or Architect.Experience with big data and streaming technologies like Kafka, Spark, or Customer Experience:o Ensure the IVR system provides a positive and efficient customer experience.o Validate voice recognition accuracy and response times in GDF / Nuance-powered IVR applications.Qualifications:Experience:o Minimum of 4 years of experience in IVR testing.o Proven experience with Cyara, including test case creation and execution.o Hands-on experience with GDF, Watson, Amazon connect, Avaya, Genesys, and Nuance platforms.Skills:o Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.o Excellent written and verbal communication skills.o Ability to work independently and as part of a team.hashtag#ivr hashtag#javaivr hashtag#gdf hashtag#cyara hashtag#genesys hashtag#avaya hashtag#java hashtag#googledialogflow hashtag#vxml hashtag#automation hashtag#testing hashtag#nuance hashtag#voice hashtag#voicerecognition hashtag#watson hashtag#amazonconnect hashtag#manualtesting hashtag#resume hashtag#hiring hashtag#immedaitehiring

Post Content:
This position pays between $25 and $35 per hour.  Load Test Engineer (3-month Contract)This role is expected to: - Gather initial environment requirements and determine the necessary toolset for performance testing.- Define performance testing criteria and parameters.- Model and simulate complex testing scenarios.- Design appropriate test flows based on business use cases.- Develop load tests for components, microservices, APIs, and end-to-end user journeys.- Configure and execute tests utilizing various load generating platforms.- Utilize application performance monitoring tools to identify and diagnose bottlenecks across multiple technologies, platforms, and datasets.- Analyze application characteristics and capacities to prepare for high-volume transaction periods.- Prepare and execute test scenarios to reproduce production issues in lower scaled environments.- Document all testing results and analysis in clear and concise formats.- Communicate test results and analysis to technical leads and stakeholders.- Demonstrate strong technical expertise in writing complex testing scripts using tools such as JMeter/BlazeMeter and LoadRunner. Possess hands-on scripting experience with programming languages/tools such as Java, HTML, Selenium, K6, JavaScript, Python, SQL, or shell scripting.- Familiarity with APM tools such as DynaTrace, DataDog, or AppDynamics is required.- Actively participate in multiple remote meetings on a daily basis.- Demonstrate ability to adapt to shifting priorities.- Possess effective communication skills within a business context.- Verify the impact of any application or infrastructure change (e.g., Maintenance Releases, hardware, OS upgrades)â€¦Read the full job description here: https://lnkd.in/e6XD8pQD Location: San Francisoco, CAApplicants should apply via The Mice Groups Inc. website (www.micegroups.com), through this careers site posting, or email ashish.shinde@micegroups.com for this position. Pay for this position is based on market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. As a contractor you may also be eligible for health benefits such as health, dental, and vision as well as access to a 401K plan.  We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at The Mice Groups Inc. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.Pursuant to the Los Angeles Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records. The Mice Groups Inc. values your privacy. Please consult our Candidate Privacy Notice, for information about how we collect, use, and disclose personal information of our candidates.

This position pays between $25 and $35 per hour.  Load Test Engineer (3-month Contract)This role is expected to: - Gather initial environment requirements and determine the necessary toolset for performance testing.- Define performance testing criteria and parameters.- Model and simulate complex testing scenarios.- Design appropriate test flows based on business use cases.- Develop load tests for components, microservices, APIs, and end-to-end user journeys.- Configure and execute tests utilizing various load generating platforms.- Utilize application performance monitoring tools to identify and diagnose bottlenecks across multiple technologies, platforms, and datasets.- Analyze application characteristics and capacities to prepare for high-volume transaction periods.- Prepare and execute test scenarios to reproduce production issues in lower scaled environments.- Document all testing results and analysis in clear and concise formats.- Communicate test results and analysis to technical leads and stakeholders.- Demonstrate strong technical expertise in writing complex testing scripts using tools such as JMeter/BlazeMeter and LoadRunner. Possess hands-on scripting experience with programming languages/tools such as Java, HTML, Selenium, K6, JavaScript, Python, SQL, or shell scripting.- Familiarity with APM tools such as DynaTrace, DataDog, or AppDynamics is required.- Actively participate in multiple remote meetings on a daily basis.- Demonstrate ability to adapt to shifting priorities.- Possess effective communication skills within a business context.- Verify the impact of any application or infrastructure change (e.g., Maintenance Releases, hardware, OS upgrades)â€¦Read the full job description here: https://lnkd.in/e6XD8pQD Location: San Francisoco, CAApplicants should apply via The Mice Groups Inc. website (www.micegroups.com), through this careers site posting, or email ashish.shinde@micegroups.com for this position. Pay for this position is based on market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. As a contractor you may also be eligible for health benefits such as health, dental, and vision as well as access to a 401K plan.  We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at The Mice Groups Inc. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.Pursuant to the Los Angeles Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records. The Mice Groups Inc. values your privacy. Please consult our Candidate Privacy Notice, for information about how we collect, use, and disclose personal information of our candidates.

in data migration from relational databases (e.g., Oracle, MySQL) to MongoDB.Experience integrating MongoDB with programming languages like Python, Java, or Node.js.Knowledge of data security, compliance (e.g., GDPR, HIPAA), and backup/restore strategies.Familiarity with DevOps practices, including CI/CD pipelines and infrastructure as code (Terraform, Ansible).Strong communication and documentation skills with a collaborative mindset.Preferred Qualifications:MongoDB Certified DBA/Developer or Architect.Experience with big data and streaming technologies like Kafka, Spark, or This position pays between $25 and $35 per hour.  Load Test Engineer (3-month Contract)This role is expected to: - Gather initial environment requirements and determine the necessary toolset for performance testing.- Define performance testing criteria and parameters.- Model and simulate complex testing scenarios.- Design appropriate test flows based on business use cases.- Develop load tests for components, microservices, APIs, and end-to-end user journeys.- Configure and execute tests utilizing various load generating platforms.- Utilize application performance monitoring tools to identify and diagnose bottlenecks across multiple technologies, platforms, and datasets.- Analyze application characteristics and capacities to prepare for high-volume transaction periods.- Prepare and execute test scenarios to reproduce production issues in lower scaled environments.- Document all testing results and analysis in clear and concise formats.- Communicate test results and analysis to technical leads and stakeholders.- Demonstrate strong technical expertise in writing complex testing scripts using tools such as JMeter/BlazeMeter and LoadRunner. Possess hands-on scripting experience with programming languages/tools such as Java, HTML, Selenium, K6, JavaScript, Python, SQL, or shell scripting.- Familiarity with APM tools such as DynaTrace, DataDog, or AppDynamics is required.- Actively participate in multiple remote meetings on a daily basis.- Demonstrate ability to adapt to shifting priorities.- Possess effective communication skills within a business context.- Verify the impact of any application or infrastructure change (e.g., Maintenance Releases, hardware, OS upgrades)â€¦Read the full job description here: https://lnkd.in/e6XD8pQD Location: San Francisoco, CAApplicants should apply via The Mice Groups Inc. website (www.micegroups.com), through this careers site posting, or email ashish.shinde@micegroups.com for this position. Pay for this position is based on market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. As a contractor you may also be eligible for health benefits such as health, dental, and vision as well as access to a 401K plan.  We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at The Mice Groups Inc. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.Pursuant to the Los Angeles Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records. The Mice Groups Inc. values your privacy. Please consult our Candidate Privacy Notice, for information about how we collect, use, and disclose personal information of our candidates.

in data migration from relational databases (e.g., Oracle, MySQL) to MongoDB.Experience integrating MongoDB with programming languages like Python, Java, or Node.js.Knowledge of data security, compliance (e.g., GDPR, HIPAA), and backup/restore strategies.Familiarity with DevOps practices, including CI/CD pipelines and infrastructure as code (Terraform, Ansible).Strong communication and documentation skills with a collaborative mindset.Preferred Qualifications:MongoDB Certified DBA/Developer or Architect.Experience with big data and streaming technologies like Kafka, Spark, or This position pays between $25 and $35 per hour.  Load Test Engineer (3-month Contract)This role is expected to: - Gather initial environment requirements and determine the necessary toolset for performance testing.- Define performance testing criteria and parameters.- Model and simulate complex testing scenarios.- Design appropriate test flows based on business use cases.- Develop load tests for components, microservices, APIs, and end-to-end user journeys.- Configure and execute tests utilizing various load generating platforms.- Utilize application performance monitoring tools to identify and diagnose bottlenecks across multiple technologies, platforms, and datasets.- Analyze application characteristics and capacities to prepare for high-volume transaction periods.- Prepare and execute test scenarios to reproduce production issues in lower scaled environments.- Document all testing results and analysis in clear and concise formats.- Communicate test results and analysis to technical leads and stakeholders.- Demonstrate strong technical expertise in writing complex testing scripts using tools such as JMeter/BlazeMeter and LoadRunner. Possess hands-on scripting experience with programming languages/tools such as Java, HTML, Selenium, K6, JavaScript, Python, SQL, or shell scripting.- Familiarity with APM tools such as DynaTrace, DataDog, or AppDynamics is required.- Actively participate in multiple remote meetings on a daily basis.- Demonstrate ability to adapt to shifting priorities.- Possess effective communication skills within a business context.- Verify the impact of any application or infrastructure change (e.g., Maintenance Releases, hardware, OS upgrades)â€¦Read the full job description here: https://lnkd.in/e6XD8pQD Location: San Francisoco, CAApplicants should apply via The Mice Groups Inc. website (www.micegroups.com), through this careers site posting, or email ashish.shinde@micegroups.com for this position. Pay for this position is based on market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. As a contractor you may also be eligible for health benefits such as health, dental, and vision as well as access to a 401K plan.  We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at The Mice Groups Inc. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.Pursuant to the Los Angeles Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records. The Mice Groups Inc. values your privacy. Please consult our Candidate Privacy Notice, for information about how we collect, use, and disclose personal information of our candidates.

Job Title: MongoDB Data ArchitectLocation: RemoteJob Type: ContractNeed a candidate who can work in the EST time zone.Job Overview:We are seeking an experienced MongoDB Data Architect to lead the design, development, and implementation of scalable and secure MongoDB database solutions. As a critical member of our data architecture team, you will be responsible for ensuring high performance, availability, and data integrity across all MongoDB-based applications. This role requires deep expertise in MongoDB design patterns, performance tuning, and integration with modern application ecosystems.Key Responsibilities:Design and implement scalable MongoDB database architectures for high availability and performance.Define data models that align with business needs, ensuring efficiency, consistency, and data integrity.Develop strategies for data migration, transformation, and integration between MongoDB and other platforms.Optimize and tune MongoDB queries, indexes, and schema designs to enhance performance.Implement and maintain security best practices, including role-based access control and encryption.Collaborate with DevOps teams to manage database deployment and monitoring in cloud and on-prem environments.Establish data governance frameworks, backup strategies, and disaster recovery plans for MongoDB databases.Provide architectural guidance and technical leadership to developers and database administrators.Evaluate and implement tools and technologies to enhance the MongoDB ecosystem (e.g., BI connectors, caching layers, and analytics tools).Document database designs, architectures, policies, and procedures.Required Interested candidates can send your resume to naveen@kovantech.comJob Title: Java IVR DeveloperDuration: ContractLocation: RemoteJob description:We are seeking a highly skilled IVR Testing Specialist to join our team. The ideal candidate will have extensive experience in testing Interactive Voice Response (IVR) systems, with a strong focus on using Cyara for test automation. The role requires a deep understanding of both inbound and outbound IVR processes and hands-on experience with few of IVR development technologies / platforms like GDF, Watson, Amazon connect, Avaya, Genesys, and Nuance.Key Responsibilities:1. IVR Testing:o Develop and execute test plans for IVR systems, ensuring all functionalities are thoroughly tested.o Utilize Cyara for automated testing of IVR scripts and call flows.o Conduct manual testing as needed to validate specific scenarios and edge cases.2. System Integration:o Collaborate with development and deployment teams to ensure seamless integration of IVR systems with other platforms.o Test and validate the performance of IVR development technologies / platforms on GDF, Watson, Amazon connect, Avaya, Genesys, and Nuance platforms.3. Hi hashtag#connections,Currently we are hiring Java IVR Developer - Contract - Remote. Interested candidates can send your resume to naveen@kovantech.comJob Title: Java IVR DeveloperDuration: ContractLocation: RemoteJob description:We are seeking a highly skilled IVR Testing Specialist to join our team. The ideal candidate will have extensive experience in testing Interactive Voice Response (IVR) systems, with a strong focus on using Cyara for test automation. The role requires a deep understanding of both inbound and outbound IVR processes and hands-on experience with few of IVR development technologies / platforms like GDF, Watson, Amazon connect, Avaya, Genesys, and Nuance.Key Responsibilities:1. IVR Testing:o Develop and execute test plans for IVR systems, ensuring all functionalities are thoroughly tested.o Utilize Cyara for automated testing of IVR scripts and call flows.o Conduct manual testing as needed to validate specific scenarios and edge cases.2. System Integration:o Collaborate with development and deployment teams to ensure seamless integration of IVR systems with other platforms.o Test and validate the performance of IVR development technologies / platforms on GDF, Watson, Amazon connect, Avaya, Genesys, and Nuance platforms.3. Quality Assurance:o Identify and document defects, working closely with developers to resolve issues.o Perform regression testing to ensure new updates do not negatively impact existing functionalities.o Monitor and report on the quality and performance of IVR systems.4. Project Coordination:o Work with project managers to define testing timelines and deliverables.o Provide regular status updates and testing reports to stakeholders.5. Customer Experience:o Ensure the IVR system provides a positive and efficient customer experience.o Validate voice recognition accuracy and response times in GDF / Nuance-powered IVR applications.Qualifications:Experience:o Minimum of 4 years of experience in IVR testing.o Proven experience with Cyara, including test case creation and execution.o Hands-on experience with GDF, Watson, Amazon connect, Avaya, Genesys, and Nuance platforms.Skills:o Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.o Excellent written and verbal communication skills.o Ability to work independently and as part of a team.hashtag#ivr hashtag#javaivr hashtag#gdf hashtag#cyara hashtag#genesys hashtag#avaya hashtag#java hashtag#googledialogflow hashtag#vxml hashtag#automation hashtag#testing hashtag#nuance hashtag#voice hashtag#voicerecognition hashtag#watson hashtag#amazonconnect hashtag#manualtesting hashtag#resume hashtag#hiring hashtag#immedaitehiring

Post Content:
This position pays between $25 and $35 per hour.  Load Test Engineer (3-month Contract)This role is expected to: - Gather initial environment requirements and determine the necessary toolset for performance testing.- Define performance testing criteria and parameters.- Model and simulate complex testing scenarios.- Design appropriate test flows based on business use cases.- Develop load tests for components, microservices, APIs, and end-to-end user journeys.- Configure and execute tests utilizing various load generating platforms.- Utilize application performance monitoring tools to identify and diagnose bottlenecks across multiple technologies, platforms, and datasets.- Analyze application characteristics and capacities to prepare for high-volume transaction periods.- Prepare and execute test scenarios to reproduce production issues in lower scaled environments.- Document all testing results and analysis in clear and concise formats.- Communicate test results and analysis to technical leads and stakeholders.- Demonstrate strong technical expertise in writing complex testing scripts using tools such as JMeter/BlazeMeter and LoadRunner. Possess hands-on scripting experience with programming languages/tools such as Java, HTML, Selenium, K6, JavaScript, Python, SQL, or shell scripting.- Familiarity with APM tools such as DynaTrace, DataDog, or AppDynamics is required.- Actively participate in multiple remote meetings on a daily basis.- Demonstrate ability to adapt to shifting priorities.- Possess effective communication skills within a business context.- Verify the impact of any application or infrastructure change (e.g., Maintenance Releases, hardware, OS upgrades)â€¦Read the full job description here: https://lnkd.in/e6XD8pQD Location: San Francisoco, CAApplicants should apply via The Mice Groups Inc. website (www.micegroups.com), through this careers site posting, or email ashish.shinde@micegroups.com for this position. Pay for this position is based on market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. As a contractor you may also be eligible for health benefits such as health, dental, and vision as well as access to a 401K plan.  We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at The Mice Groups Inc. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.Pursuant to the Los Angeles Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records. The Mice Groups Inc. values your privacy. Please consult our Candidate Privacy Notice, for information about how we collect, use, and disclose personal information of our candidates.

Job Title: MongoDB Data ArchitectLocation: RemoteJob Type: ContractNeed a candidate who can work in the EST time zone.Job Overview:We are seeking an experienced MongoDB Data Architect to lead the design, development, and implementation of scalable and secure MongoDB database solutions. As a critical member of our data architecture team, you will be responsible for ensuring high performance, availability, and data integrity across all MongoDB-based applications. This role requires deep expertise in MongoDB design patterns, performance tuning, and integration with modern application ecosystems.Key Responsibilities:Design and implement scalable MongoDB database architectures for high availability and performance.Define data models that align with business needs, ensuring efficiency, consistency, and data integrity.Develop strategies for data migration, transformation, and integration between MongoDB and other platforms.Optimize and tune MongoDB queries, indexes, and schema designs to enhance performance.Implement and maintain security best practices, including role-based access control and encryption.Collaborate with DevOps teams to manage database deployment and monitoring in cloud and on-prem environments.Establish data governance frameworks, backup strategies, and disaster recovery plans for MongoDB databases.Provide architectural guidance and technical leadership to developers and database administrators.Evaluate and implement tools and technologies to enhance the MongoDB ecosystem (e.g., BI connectors, caching layers, and analytics tools).Document database designs, architectures, policies, and procedures.Required Skills & Qualifications:Proven experience (5+ years) working with MongoDB as a Data Architect or in a similar role.Strong understanding of NoSQL concepts, document-based modeling, and schema design.Experience with MongoDB Atlas, sharding, replication, and cloud deployment strategies.Proficiency in MongoDB performance tuning, indexing strategies, and query optimization.Hands-on experience in data migration from relational databases (e.g., Oracle, MySQL) to MongoDB.Experience integrating MongoDB with programming languages like Python, Java, or Node.js.Knowledge of data security, compliance (e.g., GDPR, HIPAA), and backup/restore strategies.Familiarity with DevOps practices, including CI/CD pipelines and infrastructure as code (Terraform, Ansible).Strong communication and documentation skills with a collaborative mindset.Preferred Qualifications:MongoDB Certified DBA/Developer or Architect.Experience with big data and streaming technologies like Kafka, Spark, or Elasticsearch.Familiarity with BI/reporting tools integration (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).Knowledge of other NoSQL and SQL databases for hybrid data architecture.Share the profiles at rohit@elitit.com

Post Content:
This position pays between $25 and $35 per hour.  Load Test Engineer (3-month Contract)This role is expected to: - Gather initial environment requirements and determine the necessary toolset for performance testing.- Define performance testing criteria and parameters.- Model and simulate complex testing scenarios.- Design appropriate test flows based on business use cases.- Develop load tests for components, microservices, APIs, and end-to-end user journeys.- Configure and execute tests utilizing various load generating platforms.- Utilize application performance monitoring tools to identify and diagnose bottlenecks across multiple technologies, platforms, and datasets.- Analyze application characteristics and capacities to prepare for high-volume transaction periods.- Prepare and execute test scenarios to reproduce production issues in lower scaled environments.- Document all testing results and analysis in clear and concise formats.- Communicate test results and analysis to technical leads and stakeholders.- Demonstrate strong technical expertise in writing complex testing scripts using tools such as JMeter/BlazeMeter and LoadRunner. Possess hands-on scripting experience with programming languages/tools such as Java, HTML, Selenium, K6, JavaScript, Python, SQL, or shell scripting.- Familiarity with APM tools such as DynaTrace, DataDog, or AppDynamics is required.- Actively participate in multiple remote meetings on a daily basis.- Demonstrate ability to adapt to shifting priorities.- Possess effective communication skills within a business context.- Verify the impact of any application or infrastructure change (e.g., Maintenance Releases, hardware, OS upgrades)â€¦Read the full job description here: https://lnkd.in/e6XD8pQD Location: San Francisoco, CAApplicants should apply via The Mice Groups Inc. website (www.micegroups.com), through this careers site posting, or email ashish.shinde@micegroups.com for this position. Pay for this position is based on market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. As a contractor you may also be eligible for health benefits such as health, dental, and vision as well as access to a 401K plan.  We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at The Mice Groups Inc. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.Pursuant to the Los Angeles Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records. The Mice Groups Inc. values your privacy. Please consult our Candidate Privacy Notice, for information about how we collect, use, and disclose personal information of our candidates.

This position pays between $25 and $35 per hour.  Load Test Engineer (3-month Contract)This role is expected to: - Gather initial environment requirements and determine the necessary toolset for performance testing.- Define performance testing criteria and parameters.- Model and simulate complex testing scenarios.- Design appropriate test flows based on business use cases.- Develop load tests for components, microservices, APIs, and end-to-end user journeys.- Configure and execute tests utilizing various load generating platforms.- Utilize application performance monitoring tools to identify and diagnose bottlenecks across multiple technologies, platforms, and datasets.- Analyze application characteristics and capacities to prepare for high-volume transaction periods.- Prepare and execute test scenarios to reproduce production issues in lower scaled environments.- Document all testing results and analysis in clear and concise formats.- Communicate test results and analysis to technical leads and stakeholders.- Demonstrate strong technical expertise in writing complex testing scripts using tools such as JMeter/BlazeMeter and LoadRunner. Possess hands-on scripting experience with programming languages/tools such as Java, HTML, Selenium, K6, JavaScript, Python, SQL, or shell scripting.- Familiarity with APM tools such as DynaTrace, DataDog, or AppDynamics is required.- Actively participate in multiple remote meetings on a daily basis.- Demonstrate ability to adapt to shifting priorities.- Possess effective communication skills within a business context.- Verify the impact of any application or infrastructure change (e.g., Maintenance Releases, hardware, OS upgrades)â€¦Read the full job description here: https://lnkd.in/e6XD8pQD Location: San Francisoco, CAApplicants should apply via The Mice Groups Inc. website (www.micegroups.com), through this careers site posting, or email ashish.shinde@micegroups.com for this position. Pay for this position is based on market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. As a contractor you may also be eligible for health benefits such as health, dental, and vision as well as access to a 401K plan.  We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at The Mice Groups Inc. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.Pursuant to the Los Angeles Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records. The Mice Groups Inc. values your privacy. Please consult our Candidate Privacy Notice, for information about how we collect, use, and disclose personal information of our candidates.

frameworks, backup strategies, and disaster recovery plans for MongoDB databases.Provide architectural guidance and technical leadership to developers and database administrators.Evaluate and implement tools and technologies to enhance the MongoDB ecosystem (e.g., BI connectors, caching layers, and analytics tools).Document database designs, architectures, policies, and procedures.Required Skills & Qualifications:Proven experience (5+ years) working with MongoDB as a Data Architect or in a similar role.Strong understanding of NoSQL concepts, document-based modeling, and schema design.Experience with MongoDB Atlas, sharding, replication, and cloud deployment strategies.Proficiency in MongoDB performance tuning, indexing strategies, and query optimization.Hands-on experience in data migration from relational databases (e.g., Oracle, MySQL) to MongoDB.Experience integrating MongoDB with programming languages like Python, Java, or Node.js.Knowledge of data security, compliance (e.g., GDPR, HIPAA), and backup/restore strategies.Familiarity with DevOps practices, including CI/CD pipelines and infrastructure as code (Terraform, Ansible).Strong communication and documentation skills with a collaborative mindset.Preferred Qualifications:MongoDB Certified DBA/Developer or Architect.Experience with big data and streaming technologies like Kafka, Spark, or Elasticsearch.Familiarity with BI/reporting tools integration (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).Knowledge of other NoSQL and SQL databases for hybrid data architecture.Share the profiles at This position pays between $25 and $35 per hour.  Load Test Engineer (3-month Contract)This role is expected to: - Gather initial environment requirements and determine the necessary toolset for performance testing.- Define performance testing criteria and parameters.- Model and simulate complex testing scenarios.- Design appropriate test flows based on business use cases.- Develop load tests for components, microservices, APIs, and end-to-end user journeys.- Configure and execute tests utilizing various load generating platforms.- Utilize application performance monitoring tools to identify and diagnose bottlenecks across multiple technologies, platforms, and datasets.- Analyze application characteristics and capacities to prepare for high-volume transaction periods.- Prepare and execute test scenarios to reproduce production issues in lower scaled environments.- Document all testing results and analysis in clear and concise formats.- Communicate test results and analysis to technical leads and stakeholders.- Demonstrate strong technical expertise in writing complex testing scripts using tools such as JMeter/BlazeMeter and LoadRunner. Possess hands-on scripting experience with programming languages/tools such as Java, HTML, Selenium, K6, JavaScript, Python, SQL, or shell scripting.- Familiarity with APM tools such as DynaTrace, DataDog, or AppDynamics is required.- Actively participate in multiple remote meetings on a daily basis.- Demonstrate ability to adapt to shifting priorities.- Possess effective communication skills within a business context.- Verify the impact of any application or infrastructure change (e.g., Maintenance Releases, hardware, OS upgrades)â€¦Read the full job description here: https://lnkd.in/e6XD8pQD Location: San Francisoco, CAApplicants should apply via The Mice Groups Inc. website (www.micegroups.com), through this careers site posting, or email ashish.shinde@micegroups.com for this position. Pay for this position is based on market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. As a contractor you may also be eligible for health benefits such as health, dental, and vision as well as access to a 401K plan.  We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at The Mice Groups Inc. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.Pursuant to the Los Angeles Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records. design.Experience with MongoDB Atlas, sharding, replication, and cloud deployment strategies.Proficiency in MongoDB performance tuning, indexing strategies, and query optimization.Hands-on experience in data migration from relational databases (e.g., Oracle, MySQL) to MongoDB.Experience integrating MongoDB with programming languages like Python, Java, or Node.js.Knowledge of data security, compliance (e.g., GDPR, HIPAA), and backup/restore strategies.Familiarity with DevOps practices, including CI/CD pipelines and infrastructure as code (Terraform, Ansible).Strong communication and documentation skills with a collaborative mindset.Preferred Qualifications:MongoDB Certified DBA/Developer or Architect.Experience with big data and streaming technologies like Kafka, Spark, or Elasticsearch.Familiarity with BI/reporting tools integration (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).Knowledge of other NoSQL and SQL databases for hybrid data architecture.Share the profiles at This position pays between $25 and $35 per hour.  Load Test Engineer (3-month Contract)This role is expected to: - Gather initial environment requirements and determine the necessary toolset for performance testing.- Define performance testing criteria and parameters.- Model and simulate complex testing scenarios.- Design appropriate test flows based on business use cases.- Develop load tests for components, microservices, APIs, and end-to-end user journeys.- Configure and execute tests utilizing various load generating platforms.- Utilize application performance monitoring tools to identify and diagnose bottlenecks across multiple technologies, platforms, and datasets.- Analyze application characteristics and capacities to prepare for high-volume transaction periods.- Prepare and execute test scenarios to reproduce production issues in lower scaled environments.- Document all testing results and analysis in clear and concise formats.- Communicate test results and analysis to technical leads and stakeholders.- Demonstrate strong technical expertise in writing complex testing scripts using tools such as JMeter/BlazeMeter and LoadRunner. Possess hands-on scripting experience with programming languages/tools such as Java, HTML, Selenium, K6, JavaScript, Python, SQL, or shell scripting.- Familiarity with APM tools such as DynaTrace, DataDog, or AppDynamics is required.- Actively participate in multiple remote meetings on a daily basis.- Demonstrate ability to adapt to shifting priorities.- Possess effective communication skills within a business context.- Verify the impact of any application or infrastructure change (e.g., Maintenance Releases, hardware, OS upgrades)â€¦Read the full job description here: https://lnkd.in/e6XD8pQD Location: San Francisoco, CAApplicants should apply via The Mice Groups Inc. website (www.micegroups.com), through this careers site posting, or email ashish.shinde@micegroups.com for this position. Pay for this position is based on market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. As a contractor you may also be eligible for health benefits such as health, dental, and vision as well as access to a 401K plan.  We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at The Mice Groups Inc. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.Pursuant to the Los Angeles Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records. The Mice Groups Inc. values your privacy. Please consult our Candidate Privacy Notice, for information about how we collect, use, and disclose personal information of our candidates.

This position pays between $25 and $35 per hour.  Load Test Engineer (3-month Contract)This role is expected to: - Gather initial environment requirements and determine the necessary toolset for performance testing.- Define performance testing criteria and parameters.- Model and simulate complex testing scenarios.- Design appropriate test flows based on business use cases.- Develop load tests for components, microservices, APIs, and end-to-end user journeys.- Configure and execute tests utilizing various load generating platforms.- Utilize application performance monitoring tools to identify and diagnose bottlenecks across multiple technologies, platforms, and datasets.- Analyze application characteristics and capacities to prepare for high-volume transaction periods.- Prepare and execute test scenarios to reproduce production issues in lower scaled environments.- Document all testing results and analysis in clear and concise formats.- Communicate test results and analysis to technical leads and stakeholders.- Demonstrate strong technical expertise in writing complex testing scripts using tools such as JMeter/BlazeMeter and LoadRunner. Possess hands-on scripting experience with programming languages/tools such as Java, HTML, Selenium, K6, JavaScript, Python, SQL, or shell scripting.- Familiarity with APM tools such as DynaTrace, DataDog, or AppDynamics is required.- Actively participate in multiple remote meetings on a daily basis.- Demonstrate ability to adapt to shifting priorities.- Possess effective communication skills within a business context.- Verify the impact of any application or infrastructure change (e.g., Maintenance Releases, hardware, OS upgrades)â€¦Read the full job description here: https://lnkd.in/e6XD8pQD Location: San Francisoco, CAApplicants should apply via The Mice Groups Inc. website (www.micegroups.com), through this careers site posting, or email ashish.shinde@micegroups.com for this position. Pay for this position is based on market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. As a contractor you may also be eligible for health benefits such as health, dental, and vision as well as access to a 401K plan.  We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at The Mice Groups Inc. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.Pursuant to the Los Angeles Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records. architectures for high availability and performance.Define data models that align with business needs, ensuring efficiency, consistency, and data integrity.Develop strategies for data migration, transformation, and integration between MongoDB and other platforms.Optimize and tune MongoDB queries, indexes, and schema designs to enhance performance.Implement and maintain security best practices, including role-based access control and encryption.Collaborate with DevOps teams to manage database deployment and monitoring in cloud and on-prem environments.Establish data governance frameworks, backup strategies, and disaster recovery plans for MongoDB databases.Provide architectural guidance and technical leadership to developers and database administrators.Evaluate and implement tools and technologies to enhance the MongoDB ecosystem (e.g., BI connectors, caching layers, and analytics tools).Document database designs, architectures, policies, and procedures.Required Skills & Qualifications:Proven experience (5+ years) working with MongoDB as a Data Architect or in a similar role.Strong understanding of NoSQL concepts, document-based modeling, and schema design.Experience with MongoDB Atlas, sharding, replication, and cloud deployment strategies.Proficiency in MongoDB performance tuning, indexing strategies, and query optimization.Hands-on experience in data migration from relational databases (e.g., Oracle, MySQL) to MongoDB.Experience integrating MongoDB with programming languages like Python, Java, or Node.js.Knowledge of data security, compliance (e.g., GDPR, HIPAA), and backup/restore strategies.Familiarity with DevOps practices, including CI/CD pipelines and infrastructure as code (Terraform, Ansible).Strong communication and documentation skills with a collaborative mindset.Preferred Qualifications:MongoDB Certified DBA/Developer or Architect.Experience with big data and streaming technologies like Kafka, Spark, or Elasticsearch.Familiarity with BI/reporting tools integration (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).Knowledge of other NoSQL and SQL databases for hybrid data architecture.Share the profiles at rohit@elitit.com

This position pays between $25 and $35 per hour.  Load Test Engineer (3-month Contract)This role is expected to: - Gather initial environment requirements and determine the necessary toolset for performance testing.- Define performance testing criteria and parameters.- Model and simulate complex testing scenarios.- Design appropriate test flows based on business use cases.- Develop load tests for components, microservices, APIs, and end-to-end user journeys.- Configure and execute tests utilizing various load generating platforms.- Utilize application performance monitoring tools to identify and diagnose bottlenecks across multiple technologies, platforms, and datasets.- Analyze application characteristics and capacities to prepare for high-volume transaction periods.- Prepare and execute test scenarios to reproduce production issues in lower scaled environments.- Document all testing results and analysis in clear and concise formats.- Communicate test results and analysis to technical leads and stakeholders.- Demonstrate strong technical expertise in writing complex testing scripts using tools such as JMeter/BlazeMeter and LoadRunner. Possess hands-on scripting experience with programming languages/tools such as Java, HTML, Selenium, K6, JavaScript, Python, SQL, or shell scripting.- Familiarity with APM tools such as DynaTrace, DataDog, or AppDynamics is required.- Actively participate in multiple remote meetings on a daily basis.- Demonstrate ability to adapt to shifting priorities.- Possess effective communication skills within a business context.- Verify the impact of any application or infrastructure change (e.g., Maintenance Releases, hardware, OS upgrades)â€¦Read the full job description here: https://lnkd.in/e6XD8pQD Location: San Francisoco, CAApplicants should apply via The Mice Groups Inc. website (www.micegroups.com), through this careers site posting, or email ashish.shinde@micegroups.com for this position. Pay for this position is based on market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. As a contractor you may also be eligible for health benefits such as health, dental, and vision as well as access to a 401K plan.  We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at The Mice Groups Inc. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.Pursuant to the Los Angeles Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records. The Mice Groups Inc. values your privacy. Please consult our Candidate Privacy Notice, for information about how we collect, use, and disclose personal information of our candidates.

in data migration from relational databases (e.g., Oracle, MySQL) to MongoDB.Experience integrating MongoDB with programming languages like Python, Java, or Node.js.Knowledge of data security, compliance (e.g., GDPR, HIPAA), and backup/restore strategies.Familiarity with DevOps practices, including CI/CD pipelines and infrastructure as code (Terraform, Ansible).Strong communication and documentation skills with a collaborative mindset.Preferred Qualifications:MongoDB Certified DBA/Developer or Architect.Experience with big data and streaming technologies like Kafka, Spark, or Interested candidates can send your resume to naveen@kovantech.comJob Title: Java IVR DeveloperDuration: ContractLocation: RemoteJob description:We are seeking a highly skilled IVR Testing Specialist to join our team. The ideal candidate will have extensive experience in testing Interactive Voice Response (IVR) systems, with a strong focus on using Cyara for test automation. The role requires a deep understanding of both inbound and outbound IVR processes and hands-on experience with few of IVR development technologies / platforms like GDF, Watson, Amazon connect, Avaya, Genesys, and Nuance.Key Responsibilities:1. IVR Testing:o Develop and execute test plans for IVR systems, ensuring all functionalities are thoroughly tested.o Utilize Cyara for automated testing of IVR scripts and call flows.o Conduct manual testing as needed to validate specific scenarios and edge cases.2. System Integration:o Collaborate with development and deployment teams to ensure seamless integration of IVR systems with other platforms.o Test and validate the performance of IVR development technologies / platforms on GDF, Watson, Amazon connect, Avaya, Genesys, and Nuance platforms.3.
